00020 #include <iostream>
00021 #include <cstring>
00022 #include <rdkcore/serialization_binary/binarywriter.h>
00023 #include <rdkcore/serialization_binary/binaryreader.h>
00024 
00027 using namespace RDK2::Serialization;
00028 using namespace RDK2::Serialization::Binary;
00029 
00030 struct B: public Writable, public Readable {
00031     char dieci[10];
00032     
00033     B() {
00034         strcpy(dieci, "123451234"); 
00035     }
00036     void write(Writer*) const throw (WritingException);
00037     void  read(Reader*) throw (ReadingException);
00038 };
00039 
00040 struct A: public Writable, public Readable {
00041     B becero;
00042     int cavallo;
00043 
00044     void write(Writer*) const  throw (WritingException) ;
00045     void  read(Reader*) throw (ReadingException);
00046 };
00047 
00048     void B::write(Writer*r) const throw(WritingException) {
00049         r->startWriting("b");
00050             r->writeBytes(dieci, 10, "dieci");
00051         r->doneWriting();
00052     }
00053     
00054     void B::read(Reader*r)  throw (ReadingException) {
00055         r->startReading("b");
00056             int8_t * buffer; size_t n;
00057             r->read_i8( &buffer, &n, "dieci");
00058             if(n!=10)
00059                 r->error("I expected a 10 byte buffer");
00060             memcpy(dieci, buffer, 10);
00061             delete[] buffer;
00062         r->doneReading();
00063     }
00064     
00065     void A::write(Writer*r)  const throw (WritingException) {
00066         r->startWriting("a");
00067         //  r->writeObject(true, &becero, "becero");
00068         //  r->write_i32(cavallo,"cavallo");
00069         r->doneWriting();
00070     }
00071 
00072     void A::read(Reader*r)  throw (ReadingException) {
00073         r->startReading("a");
00074         //  r->readObject( &becero, "becero");
00075         //  cavallo = r->read_i32("cavallo");
00076         //  if(cavallo<=0) 
00077         //      r->error("Dove vado senza un cavallo?");
00078         r->doneReading();
00079     }
00080     
00081 int main() {
00082     try {
00083         // I nostri dati
00084         A a; a.cavallo = 12;
00085         
00086         // Scrittura come stringa binaria
00087         BinaryWriter binaryWriter(true);
00088         string binary = binaryWriter.serialize(true,&a);
00089         
00090         std::cout << binary;
00091 
00092         BinaryReader binaryReader;
00093         
00094         A a2;
00095         binaryReader.deserialize(binary, &a2);
00096     } catch(SerializationException e) {
00097         std::cerr << e.what();  
00098     }
00099 }
